content.description: The White Buffalo is a small, cruiser 5.6 route. The crux is near the middle - stepping onto the arete.
content.location: This route is located near the eastern end of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: Silverado is a mixed gear route (trad and sport). The crux is where the route becomes trad, offwidthing through the top crack system.
content.protection: 4 bolts along with some cams will be the best. There are vertically-oriented anchors at the top.
content.location:
It is toward the left-center of the Cinema Wall and is located in between

Cat Ballou

and

Barquero

.

content.description: The crux is near the beginning - stepping over a bulge.
content.location: It is the furthest route on the left (west) of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: The crux is at the bottom - stepping up over a bulge.
content.location:
It is located in between

Comes a Horseman

and

Cat Ballou

toward the left end of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: The cruxes are toward the middle as well as stepping up through the bulge.
content.location:
This route is in between Brother O'Toole and

MGM Special

and is located in the middle section of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: MGM Special ascends small foot holds and hand holds to start. The crux is definitely toward the beginning heading up the slab.
content.location:
This route is located in the center of the Cinema Wall, in between

Mr. Majestic

and

Cactus Creek

.

content.description: The crux is at the top - stepping up onto the topmost rock to the anchors at the very top.
content.location:
This route is just to the east of

The White Buffalo

and just west of True Grit: A Further Adventure.

content.description:
Climb through the crack system just to the right of

Conagher

. Make easy work while placing protection through the crack.
content.location: It is the 4th furthest left route (west) on the Cinema Wall.

content.description: The crux is pulling up and over the overhung bulge to the anchors.
content.location: This route is located at the far east end of Cinema Wall, topping out just next to the Via Ferrata up climb.

content.description: The crux is halfway up the arete!
content.location:
It is near the middle of the Cinema Wall.

Barquero

is a ways to the left, and Brother O'Toole is just to the right.

climbs.name: The Duchess and The Dirt Water Fox

content.description: This competes for the tallest route on the Cinema Wall! The crux is toward the top!
content.location:
Look for the tallest and most vertical route on the wall, located in between

Curtis Loves Ross

and The Cowboys. This route is located near the eastern center of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: Climb up through a crack system to a chill ledge, then continue up and slightly left to the anchors. The crux is toward the top of the route - heading up to the anchors.
content.location:
This route is located toward the center-east end of Cinema Wall, just left of

The Duchess and The Dirt Water Fox

.

content.description: The crux is toward the top - heading to the anchors! This route runs up a small tower.
content.location: It is the third furthest route from the left side (west) of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: The crux is toward the top before the anchors. The route was set by Ben Black.
content.location:
Located on the Cinema Wall, near the left side (west), this route is in between

The Sacketts

and

Silverado

.

content.description: The cruxes are toward the bottom: getting over the bulge and heading up and right through the notch.
content.location: It is the second furthest route on the left side (west) of the Cinema Wall.

content.description: The crux is toward the beginning - stepping on small holds until you find the jugs.
content.location:
It is the 5th furthest route from the left side (west) of Cinema Wall, in between

The Legend of Buckskin Joe

and

The Sacketts

.

content.description: The crux is pulling up and over the large bulge, where it becomes exposed on a right angled arete.
content.location:
This route is located at the center section of the Cinema Wall, in between

MGM Special

just to the left and

Curtis Loves Ross

around the corner to the right.

content.description: Climb the steep face up to the bulge. The crux is pulling over the bulge and up some easier terrain to the anchors.
content.location:
This route is near the center of the Cinema Wall. It is located between

Silverado

and

How the West Was Won

.
